properties.tree_description:
Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Bowed canopy with upper crown offset approx. 15 ft over neighboring property; interdependent structural root plate with adjacent pine.
		
		
			Tree number:2Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):24Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Deeply cut fusiform canker high in canopy; offset canopy weight distribution favoring neighboring occupied structure; interdependent structural root plate with Tree 1.
		
		
			Tree number:3Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):21Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Noticeable canopy decline with significant needle thinning estimated at approx. 70 percent reduction compared to adjacent pines.
		
		
			Tree number:4Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):20Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Fusiform canker at mid-bole at old dead branch site, deeply cut into structural wood; off-balance upper canopy with codominant, meandering leaders; interdependent structural root plate with Tree 3 approx. 7 ft apart.
		
		
			Tree number:5Species:Magnolia Tree Size (DBH):15Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Former triple-trunk structure; two prior stems removed; visible wood loss and decay at former stem unions; resprouted growth form.
		
		
			Tree number:6Species:White Oak Tree Size (DBH):36Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Possibly previously denied under BA-2025033325 as a 46-inch White oak; current field measurement differs and condition raises uncertainty whether the same tree was evaluated. Codominant with approx. 7 ft bark inclusion; fungal conks affecting approx. 50 percent of basal circumference; decay confirmed by sounding; chronic root disturbance from long-term equipment and material storage including broken equipment, fuel containers, and decayed firewood; observable canopy decline with noticeable deadfall and decayed branches scattered around the base of Trees 6 and 7; occupied target present on adjacent property. Sounding video to be uploaded to Accela.
		
		
			Tree number:7Species:White Oak Tree Size (DBH):23Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Off-balance phototropic canopy; codominant structure with meandering form; canopy largely covered in English ivy limiting full visual inspection; chronic material and equipment storage at base including fuel containers and debris suggesting likely root disturbance; noticeable white oak deadfall present in vicinity; interdependent structural root plate with Tree 6.
		
		
			Tree number:8Species:Black Cherry Tree Size (DBH):8Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Pronounced dogleg lean with significant phototropic bend over fence line toward adjacent structure; bowed stem form with offset leader; limited upper crown structure.
		
		
			Tree number:9Species:Elm Tree Size (DBH):34Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:One broken leader with ripped-off fracture at former leader attachment; embedded rebar, hog wire, and additional wire at base; evidence of ground disturbance associated with past curbing or hardscape work within past two decades relative to tree age; canopy and trunk largely covered in English ivy limiting full inspection.
		
		
			Tree number:10Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):30Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Fusiform canker at mid-bole with stem deformation.
		
		
			Tree number:11Species:Pine Tree Size (DBH):32Tree location:See site map Description of Tree:Numbered flagging tape Reason for Removal:OtherComments:Deformed structural root plate; pronounced dogleg at lower mid-trunk; predominant canopy mass leaning toward neighboring occupied dwelling.
